Entry.JapaneseText: <Mao>、<Eugene>、軍を出てからの 旅だけど、食事はどうしてたんだ？
Entry.EnglishText: So, <Mao>, <Eugene>, after you left the army, what did the two of you do for food?

Entry.JapaneseText: 俺が担当していた。軍隊仕込みの、 そぼくなものしか作らなかったがな。
Entry.EnglishText: I was in charge of the cooking. All we ate were simple military rations that I would prepare.

Entry.JapaneseText: そんなコトないよ、けっこう手が込んでたし、 手際も良くって、上手だったヨ！
Entry.EnglishText: Don't sell yourself short, your cooking was intricate and well made! You were an expert at it!

Entry.JapaneseText: そうか……それを言うなら、俺が風邪で寝込んだ時、 <Mao>が作ってくれたおかゆもうまかったぞ……
Entry.EnglishText: I see... Well, on that note, the porridge you made when I was bedridden with a cold was good as well...
